page.title: 12Radio, newspapers, Murroes
page.content:
On{radio}a high quality{BBC}signal can be obtained from the VHF transmitter at Douglaswood, but a large number of listeners also tune in to{Radio Tay,}the local commercial station serving Dundee and Perth. It transmits on both the medium wave and VHF from near the south end of the Tay Road Bridge.
The vast majority of homes take the Courier or Evening Telegraph {newspapers}published in Dundee by D.C. Thomson, the well known publishers of newspapers, comics and magazines. A small minority read national dailies such as the Daily Record or the Sun, and an even smaller number "quality" dailies eg. the Glasgow Herald or Scotsman.
